description: Word 2016 Advanced for Mac explores ways to enhance Word documents with graphical elements that include images, shapes, tables, and charts. The series also demonstrates different techniques for users to automate tasks by using templates, macros, and mail merge. While Word 2016 Advanced for Mac is a continuation from the Word 2016 Essentials for Mac series, it can be viewed as a standalone course for users looking to go beyond just adding and formatting text.
descriptionMD: Word 2016 Advanced for Mac explores ways to enhance Word documents with graphical elements that include images, shapes, tables, and charts. The series also demonstrates different techniques for users to automate tasks by using templates, macros, and mail merge. While Word 2016 Advanced for Mac is a continuation from the Word 2016 Essentials for Mac series, it can be viewed as a standalone course for users looking to go beyond just adding and formatting text.
name: Word 2016 Advanced for Mac
subtitle: Document and word processing software

episodes.description: Word 2016 Advanced for Mac explores ways to enhance Word documents with graphical elements that include images, shapes, tables, and charts. The series also demonstrates different techniques for users to automate tasks by using templates, macros, and mail merge. While Word 2016 Advanced for Mac is a continuation from the Word 2016 Essentials for Mac series, it can be viewed as a standalone course for users looking to go beyond just adding and formatting text.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:05.556
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:05.556 --> 00:00:11.360
Hello everyone, my name is Vonne Smith and
this is Microsoft 2016 Advanced for Mac.

3
00:00:11.360 --> 00:00:12.900
In this course overview,

4
00:00:12.900 --> 00:00:17.090
we're going to be covering exactly
what is in this particular course.

5
00:00:17.090 --> 00:00:19.460
Who is the target audience,
who is this made for?

6
00:00:19.460 --> 00:00:21.880
What do we need to know about
before we get started, and

7
00:00:21.880 --> 00:00:25.380
any tip bits of information
that we have extra?

8
00:00:25.380 --> 00:00:28.110
In this course, there are two main topics.

9
00:00:28.110 --> 00:00:30.960
There is the graphical elements and
automation.

10
00:00:30.960 --> 00:00:35.235
So this is where we're going to be
focusing on those elements that,

11
00:00:35.235 --> 00:00:37.860
well are graphics, things like images.

12
00:00:37.860 --> 00:00:40.980
We're gonna talk about how you can
put images into your document,

13
00:00:40.980 --> 00:00:46.470
all about the important textwrap, and
even a little bit of document and

14
00:00:46.470 --> 00:00:50.190
image resolutions and
how you should kind of be aware

15
00:00:50.190 --> 00:00:54.600
of the sizes of your images when you go
ahead and place them into your Word files.

16
00:00:54.600 --> 00:00:58.300
We're also going to be getting into
shapes and how to format them,

17
00:00:58.300 --> 00:01:00.310
how to make them,
how to make them different colors,

18
00:01:00.310 --> 00:01:04.380
and talk about all the fun stuff
you can do with the styles.

19
00:01:04.380 --> 00:01:06.900
We're going to talk
about SmartArt as well.

20
00:01:06.900 --> 00:01:08.765
I love me some SmartArt.

21
00:01:08.765 --> 00:01:14.045
It's a nice way to be able to display
your information in a graphical manner.

22
00:01:14.045 --> 00:01:18.960
Give a little bit more oomph to that
information within your Word documents and

23
00:01:18.960 --> 00:01:22.350
your different reports where
things like org charts and

24
00:01:22.350 --> 00:01:27.620
different ways that you want to
demonstrate cycles or diagrams.

25
00:01:27.620 --> 00:01:30.210
That would be what we have for SmartArt.

26
00:01:30.210 --> 00:01:32.310
We're also going to be
getting into tables.

27
00:01:32.310 --> 00:01:36.140
Tables is where you go ahead and organize
information into rows and columns.

28
00:01:36.140 --> 00:01:41.060
You might think, hm tables don't seem
like images and graphics, but it

29
00:01:41.060 --> 00:01:45.910
is that graphical element of a different
way of representing that information.

30
00:01:45.910 --> 00:01:52.920
And how it works differently in a table
format and how that table interacts

31
00:01:52.920 --> 00:01:58.525
like a graphical element within
the rest of your document.

32
00:01:58.525 --> 00:02:01.555
We'll also be getting into charts
where we will be making some

33
00:02:01.555 --> 00:02:03.195
clustered column charts.

34
00:02:03.195 --> 00:02:05.195
We'll be making some pie charts and

35
00:02:05.195 --> 00:02:08.875
just understanding the foundations
of charts because there's a lot of

36
00:02:08.875 --> 00:02:12.385
terminology that is associated with
charts that it kind of throws people off.

37
00:02:12.385 --> 00:02:15.895
So we really kind of start at
a foundational level and then go ahead and

38
00:02:15.895 --> 00:02:19.150
insert as another graphical element.

39
00:02:19.150 --> 00:02:20.900
Let me get into automation.

40
00:02:20.900 --> 00:02:26.500
These are things to help make your working
in Word faster and more efficient.

41
00:02:26.500 --> 00:02:28.918
I'm going to start with templates.

42
00:02:28.918 --> 00:02:34.280
Everybody loves templates but I feel
that people kinda use the terminology

43
00:02:34.280 --> 00:02:38.780
a little bit, well, not exactly how
you're suppose to use it in Word.

44
00:02:38.780 --> 00:02:41.430
So we clarify what
exactly is a template and

45
00:02:41.430 --> 00:02:45.350
how to correctly use a template in Word.

46
00:02:45.350 --> 00:02:47.060
We also get into macros.

47
00:02:47.060 --> 00:02:49.910
How you can record your steps and
be able to play them back.

48
00:02:49.910 --> 00:02:53.786
That can really take the time that it
would do for multiple steps just kinda

49
00:02:53.786 --> 00:02:57.740
put it all into one little clickable
button and be able to run that anyways.

50
00:02:57.740 --> 00:03:00.736
But of course, there are some down sides,

51
00:03:00.736 --> 00:03:05.481
some security issues that we need
to cover within those episodes and

52
00:03:05.481 --> 00:03:11.500
we do a good job of letting you know how
to be safe with your macros in using Word.

53
00:03:11.500 --> 00:03:15.040
Get into some linked objects
about putting in some Excel

54
00:03:15.040 --> 00:03:19.400
data into your Word document, how you can
link back to that particular file, and

55
00:03:19.400 --> 00:03:21.150
all the nuances that are with that.

56
00:03:21.150 --> 00:03:24.300
And then we get into
the ever popular mail merge.

57
00:03:24.300 --> 00:03:27.260
We go into making some
different letters and

58
00:03:27.260 --> 00:03:32.410
we do labels and
envelopes and lots of fun.

59
00:03:32.410 --> 00:03:34.160
So who is this for?

60
00:03:34.160 --> 00:03:40.190
All Office users with a capital O, meaning
that this is for the Office 365 users.

61
00:03:40.190 --> 00:03:44.382
It doesn't matter if you're in a physical
office or if you're at a home office or

62
00:03:44.382 --> 00:03:47.200
just, you know,
you're in your living room.

63
00:03:47.200 --> 00:03:49.690
So that's why we have
that capital O there.

64
00:03:49.690 --> 00:03:53.676
And I call this the upper
basics to advanced level.

65
00:03:53.676 --> 00:03:56.934
So this is where,
kind of going into that prerequisites,

66
00:03:56.934 --> 00:04:01.530
you're gonna need to have a little bit
of a foundational knowledge of Word.

67
00:04:01.530 --> 00:04:03.360
We have the Word Essentials series, so

68
00:04:03.360 --> 00:04:07.830
that is more like a precursor
to this particular course.

69
00:04:07.830 --> 00:04:10.230
So things like you need to know
about like what is a style.

70
00:04:10.230 --> 00:04:14.460
You need to know about page layout,
how to select text, how to format text.

71
00:04:14.460 --> 00:04:19.690
All of those kind of foundations
of Word would be very helpful for

72
00:04:19.690 --> 00:04:21.190
this particular series.

73
00:04:21.190 --> 00:04:26.150
Then you do need to know a little bit
about your Macintosh operating system,

74
00:04:26.150 --> 00:04:27.900
understanding what the Finder is.

75
00:04:27.900 --> 00:04:30.650
We do get into a little bit more
of a keyboard shortcuts in this

76
00:04:30.650 --> 00:04:34.160
particular series, so
just having familiarity with that.

77
00:04:34.160 --> 00:04:37.580
And, of course,
being familiar with other Office products.

78
00:04:37.580 --> 00:04:40.390
We will be talking
a little bit about Excel.

79
00:04:40.390 --> 00:04:42.210
If you've never used Excel,

80
00:04:42.210 --> 00:04:46.610
you might wanna watch a show that we
have in our course library about that.

81
00:04:46.610 --> 00:04:51.330
But knowing one helps with other Office
products, so that's always a good thing.

82
00:04:52.500 --> 00:04:57.420
We do have exercise files and
episode notes that accompany every single

83
00:04:57.420 --> 00:05:01.190
one of these particular videos that
you're going to be watching, so

84
00:05:01.190 --> 00:05:02.860
definitely check that out.

85
00:05:02.860 --> 00:05:07.090
They should all be available to you
right here within this course overview.

86
00:05:07.090 --> 00:05:09.740
Meaning, all of the exercise files for

87
00:05:09.740 --> 00:05:14.040
every episode within this show,
so check that out.

88
00:05:14.040 --> 00:05:18.760
And if they're ever missing or if I'm
referring to a file that's not in that,

89
00:05:18.760 --> 00:05:19.910
let us know.

90
00:05:19.910 --> 00:05:23.320
We need to know and make sure that we
have all of our ducks in a row for

91
00:05:23.320 --> 00:05:27.900
you guys to be able to follow along
with me and have lots of fun.

92
00:05:27.900 --> 00:05:31.210
And talking about fun,
we have some extras.

93
00:05:31.210 --> 00:05:33.910
This is always something I talk
about in all of my course overviews,

94
00:05:33.910 --> 00:05:35.730
is there's always other options.

95
00:05:35.730 --> 00:05:39.500
There's a whole bunch of
ways to do things in Word,

96
00:05:39.500 --> 00:05:43.206
so if I haven't covered all of them,
there's a lot of them.

97
00:05:43.206 --> 00:05:48.210
Updates do happen and different versions,
being that this is an Office

98
00:05:48.210 --> 00:05:53.300
365 product and is always updating,
you might be on an older version or

99
00:05:53.300 --> 00:05:56.990
a younger version than
the one that I'm using.

100
00:05:56.990 --> 00:05:58.000
So definitely check that out,

101
00:05:58.000 --> 00:06:01.610
you can always see if you need to
have updates from your Help menu.

102
00:06:01.610 --> 00:06:05.398
And you can always check out
what version of a product

103
00:06:05.398 --> 00:06:10.219
that you're using through your
account settings in the home tab or

104
00:06:10.219 --> 00:06:13.833
the backstage view when
you go into the file menu,

105
00:06:13.833 --> 00:06:19.374
you should have some options there to
show exactly what version you're on.

106
00:06:19.374 --> 00:06:23.061
Because that may make a difference as
to what you're seeing on your screen

107
00:06:23.061 --> 00:06:25.030
versus what I'm showing on my screen.

108
00:06:26.300 --> 00:06:27.930
Always searching for answers.

109
00:06:27.930 --> 00:06:30.280
The internet is a wealth
of information out there.

110
00:06:30.280 --> 00:06:34.360
I do reference a lot of the Microsoft
help files within the notes.

111
00:06:34.360 --> 00:06:35.670
That should be a good place to start.

112
00:06:35.670 --> 00:06:40.070
But do some searches on your own to
get those answers that you might need.

113
00:06:40.070 --> 00:06:42.310
Everybody uses these products differently.

114
00:06:42.310 --> 00:06:46.030
So maybe you're really interested in mail
merge, well we have some episodes on that.

115
00:06:46.030 --> 00:06:49.590
Maybe you don't really use charts but
it's always good to know

116
00:06:49.590 --> 00:06:53.820
that it's available and you never know
down the road when you might need that.

117
00:06:53.820 --> 00:06:55.020
And always have fun.

118
00:06:55.020 --> 00:06:58.460
I know it can be frustrating sometimes
when you're trying to figure out like why

119
00:06:58.460 --> 00:07:00.600
doesn't this chart wanna move around.

120
00:07:00.600 --> 00:07:02.170
Well, we got that wordwrap on it.

121
00:07:02.170 --> 00:07:05.990
But just remember to just kinda, while
we're learning, have some fun in here.

122
00:07:05.990 --> 00:07:08.280
We like to have fun and I hope you do too.

123
00:07:08.280 --> 00:07:11.039
And I will see you in
some future episodes.

124
00:07:11.039 --> 00:07:15.672
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Vonne introduce the basics concepts of working with images. They differentiate file formats and explain the importance of understanding image resolution and dimensions. Vonne also shows some basic techniques for sizing images in Preview.
episodes.title: Images: Basic

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Cherokee show how to add images in Word.  They demonstrate how to add from Photos, Finder, and how to add a screenshot or screen clipping. Vonne also shows how create a snapshot in the Mac OS.
episodes.title: Images: Add

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Cherokee explore how to format images. They show how to resize images visually with the image bounding box and manually by typing in dimensions in the ribbon. They also discuss the different types of word wrap, how to crop images, and how to reset an image's effects and size.
episodes.title: Images: Format

episodes.description: Vonne and Cherokee continue demonstrating image formatting.  In this episode, they cover image borders and effects, preset styles, color corrections, artistic effects, and remove background. They also discuss the importance  of adding alternative text to images for accessibility as well as when to compress pictures in a document.
episodes.title: Images: Format Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Vonne add shapes into documents to enhance the appearance and emphasize text. Vonne shows how to add shapes and then format shapes by resizing, rotating, and changing the color of the fill and outline. She also shows how to add and format text to a shape, format shapes with the format pane, and edit individual points to create custom shape.
episodes.title: Shapes: Add and Format

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Vonne demonstrate working with multiple shapes. With shapes, Vonne shows how to duplicate, arrange stacking order, align, group and ungroup, and use the selection pane. She also covers how to insert icons, which is only available with an Office 365 subscription.
episodes.title: Shapes: Align, Arrange and Group

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Vonne discuss the purpose of and explain how to use SmartArt in Word. Vonne shows how to add SmartArt from the different galleries and then add shapes and text. She shows how to format individual shapes and/or the whole SmartArt using styles as well as how to resize, wrap text, and align within a document.
episodes.title: Smart Art

episodes.description: Vonne and Cherokee present the foundational knowledge and basic terminology associated with tables in Word.  They discuss the importance of understanding the different mouse cursor icons to able to select the right table element for formatting and table manipulation.  They also demonstrate how to treat a table as a graphical element in a Word document.
episodes.title: Tables: Introduction

episodes.description: Vonne and Cherokee continue to explore tables in Word 2016 for Mac. Vonne shows how to insert rows and columns, as well as adding text into cells. The ladies discuss why one would or would not want to merge cells, split cells, or split tables. They also explain several ways to modify a table layout such as: specifying height and width, auto-fit options, distribute rows/columns, cell alignment/margins, text directions and more!
episodes.title: Tables: Create and Layout

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Vonne discuss how to convert text into table content and vice versa. Vonne shows how to create custom tables using the draw table command. Vonne also demonstrates how to calculate totals using basic formulas as well as sorting data by single and multiple levels.
episodes.title: Tables: Create and Layout Part 2

episodes.description: Vonne and Cherokee discuss how to format tables and cell content. Vonne shows how to apply borders and shading to selected cells using the Table Tools contextual tabs as well as text formatting from the Home tab on the Ribbon. They also demonstrate how to format using styles and how to clear formatting completely.
episodes.title: Tables: Format and Design

episodes.description: Justin and Vonne introduce the foundations and terminology associated with charts.  They identify and define key terms such as data series, category axis, plot area, data labels, and many more.  They also show examples of different chart types and chart formatting options.
episodes.title: Charts: Introduction

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne show how to add and modify charts in Word 2016 for Mac. Vonne shows how to insert chart data for series and categories and how to modify existing chart data. They also identify the different areas of the chart and how to properly select elements to modify or format. They conclude with changing chart types and adding chart elements individually or with predefined layouts from the Quick Chart options.
episodes.title: Charts: Create and Layout

episodes.description: Vonne and Justin continue with charts in Word 2016. In this episode, they focus on formatting chart elements individually with fills and outlines as well as with styles. They also show how to format specific options of chart elements from the format pane. They then explore how a chart behaves as a graphical element in a Word document with positioning and wrap text.
episodes.title: Charts: Design and Format

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Daniel explore using text as graphical elements.  Vonne shows how to insert, format, and modify a text box.  She also shows how to create multiple linked text boxes to flow text from one text box to another. They also show how to insert WordArt as an individual element and how to create hyperlinks in a Word document to external webpages and files as well as internal within a document to headings and bookmarks.
episodes.title: Graphical Text Objects

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne explore the use of templates. They explain the commonly misused and misunderstood concept of a template and how to correctly use a template in Word.  They create documents from the built-in templates from Microsoft as well as creating a custom template from an existing document. They identify the default location of templates within the operating system and the importance of the normal template in Word.
episodes.title: Templates

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate how to create and edit macros. They explain how macros can be helpful in automating repeatable steps, but also emphasize the potential security risk macros can pose if executed from an unknown source.
episodes.title: Macros

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne discuss how to create linked objects in Word, specifically links to Excel content. Additionally, Vonne demonstrates how to update links, change source, and break links.
episodes.title: Linked Objects

episodes.description: Daniel and Vonne present the popular mail merge process in Word 2016. In this episode, they explain the elements needed and review the process to perform a mail merge. They demonstrate a completed mail merge with a basic letter.
episodes.title: Mail Merge

episodes.description: Daniel and Vonne continue with mail merge in Word 2016. In this episode, they demonstrate how to create labels and envelopes with a mail merge. They also cover how to create a full page of the same label, print a single label on existing label paper, and print a single envelope.
episodes.title: Labels and Envelopes
